00078 static void ll_invalidatepage(struct page *vmpage,
00079 #ifdef HAVE_INVALIDATE_RANGE
00080                                 unsigned int offset, unsigned int length
00081 #else
00082                                 unsigned long offset
00083 #endif
00084                              )
00085 {
00086         struct inode     *inode;
00087         struct lu_env    *env;
00088         struct cl_page   *page;
00089         struct cl_object *obj;
00090 
00091         __u16 refcheck;
00092 
00093         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00094         LASSERT(!PageWriteback(vmpage));
00095 
00096         /*
00097          * It is safe to not check anything in invalidatepage/releasepage
00098          * below because they are run with page locked and all our io is
00099          * happening with locked page too
00100          */
00101 #ifdef HAVE_INVALIDATE_RANGE
00102         if (offset == 0 && length == PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00103 #else
00104         if (offset == 0) {
00105 #endif
00106                 env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
00107                 if (!IS_ERR(env)) {
00108                         inode = vmpage->mapping->host;
00109                         obj = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob;
00110                         if (obj != NULL) {
00111                                 page = cl_vmpage_page(vmpage, obj);
00112                                 if (page != NULL) {
00113                                         cl_page_delete(env, page);
00114                                         cl_page_put(env, page);
00115                                 }
00116                         } else
00117                                 LASSERT(vmpage->private == 0);
00118                         cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00119                 }
00120         }
00121 }
00122 
00123 #ifdef HAVE_RELEASEPAGE_WITH_INT
00124 #define RELEASEPAGE_ARG_TYPE int
00125 #else
00126 #define RELEASEPAGE_ARG_TYPE gfp_t
00127 #endif
00128 static int ll_releasepage(struct page *vmpage, RELEASEPAGE_ARG_TYPE gfp_mask)
00129 {
00130         struct lu_env           *env;
00131         void                    *cookie;
00132         struct cl_object        *obj;
00133         struct cl_page          *page;
00134         struct address_space    *mapping;
00135         int result = 0;
00136 
00137         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00138         if (PageWriteback(vmpage) || PageDirty(vmpage))
00139                 return 0;
00140 
00141         mapping = vmpage->mapping;
00142         if (mapping == NULL)
00143                 return 1;
00144 
00145         obj = ll_i2info(mapping->host)->lli_clob;
00146         if (obj == NULL)
00147                 return 1;
00148 
00149         /* 1 for caller, 1 for cl_page and 1 for page cache */
00150         if (page_count(vmpage) > 3)
00151                 return 0;
00152 
00153         page = cl_vmpage_page(vmpage, obj);
00154         if (page == NULL)
00155                 return 1;
00156 
00157         cookie = cl_env_reenter();
00158         env = cl_env_percpu_get();
00159         LASSERT(!IS_ERR(env));
00160 
00161         if (!cl_page_in_use(page)) {
00162                 result = 1;
00163                 cl_page_delete(env, page);
00164         }
00165 
00166         /* To use percpu env array, the call path can not be rescheduled;
00167          * otherwise percpu array will be messed if ll_releaspage() called
00168          * again on the same CPU.
00169          *
00170          * If this page holds the last refc of cl_object, the following
00171          * call path may cause reschedule:
00172          *   cl_page_put -> cl_page_free -> cl_object_put ->
00173          *     lu_object_put -> lu_object_free -> lov_delete_raid0.
00174          *
00175          * However, the kernel can't get rid of this inode until all pages have
00176          * been cleaned up. Now that we hold page lock here, it's pretty safe
00177          * that we won't get into object delete path.
00178          */
00179         LASSERT(cl_object_refc(obj) > 1);
00180         cl_page_put(env, page);
00181 
00182         cl_env_percpu_put(env);
00183         cl_env_reexit(cookie);
00184         return result;
00185 }
00186 
00187 #define MAX_DIRECTIO_SIZE 2*1024*1024*1024UL
00188 
00189 ssize_t ll_direct_rw_pages(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
00190                            int rw, struct inode *inode,
00191                            struct ll_dio_pages *pv)
00192 {
00193         struct cl_page    *clp;
00194         struct cl_2queue  *queue;
00195         struct cl_object  *obj = io->ci_obj;
00196         int i;
00197         ssize_t rc = 0;
00198         loff_t file_offset  = pv->ldp_start_offset;
00199         size_t size         = pv->ldp_size;
00200         int page_count      = pv->ldp_nr;
00201         struct page **pages = pv->ldp_pages;
00202         size_t page_size    = cl_page_size(obj);
00203         bool do_io;
00204         int  io_pages       = 0;
00205         ENTRY;
00206 
00207         queue = &io->ci_queue;
00208         cl_2queue_init(queue);
00209         for (i = 0; i < page_count; i++) {
00210                 if (pv->ldp_offsets)
00211                     file_offset = pv->ldp_offsets[i];
00212 
00213                 LASSERT(!(file_offset & (page_size - 1)));
00214                 clp = cl_page_find(env, obj, cl_index(obj, file_offset),
00215                                    pv->ldp_pages[i], CPT_TRANSIENT);
00216                 if (IS_ERR(clp)) {
00217                         rc = PTR_ERR(clp);
00218                         break;
00219                 }
00220 
00221                 rc = cl_page_own(env, io, clp);
00222                 if (rc) {
00223                         LASSERT(clp->cp_state == CPS_FREEING);
00224                         cl_page_put(env, clp);
00225                         break;
00226                 }
00227 
00228                 do_io = true;
00229 
00230                 /* check the page type: if the page is a host page, then do
00231                  * write directly */
00232                 if (clp->cp_type == CPT_CACHEABLE) {
00233                         struct page *vmpage = cl_page_vmpage(clp);
00234                         struct page *src_page;
00235                         struct page *dst_page;
00236                         void       *src;
00237                         void       *dst;
00238 
00239                         src_page = (rw == WRITE) ? pages[i] : vmpage;
00240                         dst_page = (rw == WRITE) ? vmpage : pages[i];
00241 
00242                         src = ll_kmap_atomic(src_page, KM_USER0);
00243                         dst = ll_kmap_atomic(dst_page, KM_USER1);
00244                         memcpy(dst, src, min(page_size, size));
00245                         ll_kunmap_atomic(dst, KM_USER1);
00246                         ll_kunmap_atomic(src, KM_USER0);
00247 
00248                         /* make sure page will be added to the transfer by
00249                          * cl_io_submit()->...->vvp_page_prep_write(). */
00250                         if (rw == WRITE)
00251                                 set_page_dirty(vmpage);
00252 
00253                         if (rw == READ) {
00254                                 /* do not issue the page for read, since it
00255                                  * may reread a ra page which has NOT uptodate
00256                                  * bit set. */
00257                                 cl_page_disown(env, io, clp);
00258                                 do_io = false;
00259                         }
00260                 }
00261 
00262                 if (likely(do_io)) {
00263                         cl_2queue_add(queue, clp);
00264 
00265                         /*
00266                          * Set page clip to tell transfer formation engine
00267                          * that page has to be sent even if it is beyond KMS.
00268                          */
00269                         cl_page_clip(env, clp, 0, min(size, page_size));
00270 
00271                         ++io_pages;
00272                 }
00273 
00274                 /* drop the reference count for cl_page_find */
00275                 cl_page_put(env, clp);
00276                 size -= page_size;
00277                 file_offset += page_size;
00278         }
00279 
00280         if (rc == 0 && io_pages) {
00281                 rc = cl_io_submit_sync(env, io,
00282                                        rw == READ ? CRT_READ : CRT_WRITE,
00283                                        queue, 0);
00284         }
00285         if (rc == 0)
00286                 rc = pv->ldp_size;
00287 
00288         cl_2queue_discard(env, io, queue);
00289         cl_2queue_disown(env, io, queue);
00290         cl_2queue_fini(env, queue);
00291         RETURN(rc);
00292 }
00293 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ll_direct_rw_pages);
00294 
00295 static ssize_t
00296 ll_direct_IO_seg(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io, int rw,
00297                  struct inode *inode, size_t size, loff_t file_offset,
00298                  struct page **pages, int page_count)
00299 {
00300         struct ll_dio_pages pvec = { .ldp_pages         = pages,
00301                                      .ldp_nr            = page_count,
00302                                      .ldp_size          = size,
00303                                      .ldp_offsets       = NULL,
00304                                      .ldp_start_offset  = file_offset
00305                                    };
00306 
00307         return ll_direct_rw_pages(env, io, rw, inode, &pvec);
00308 }
00309 
00310 /*  ll_free_user_pages - tear down page struct array
00311  *  @pages: array of page struct pointers underlying target buffer */
00312 static void ll_free_user_pages(struct page **pages, int npages, int do_dirty)
00313 {
00314         int i;
00315 
00316         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
00317                 if (pages[i] == NULL)
00318                         break;
00319                 if (do_dirty)
00320                         set_page_dirty_lock(pages[i]);
00321                 page_cache_release(pages[i]);
00322         }
00323 
00324 #if defined(HAVE_DIRECTIO_ITER) || defined(HAVE_IOV_ITER_RW)
00325         kvfree(pages);
00326 #else
00327         OBD_FREE_LARGE(pages, npages * sizeof(*pages));
00328 #endif
00329 }
00330 
00331 #ifdef KMALLOC_MAX_SIZE
00332 #define MAX_MALLOC KMALLOC_MAX_SIZE
00333 #else
00334 #define MAX_MALLOC (128 * 1024)
00335 #endif
00336 
00337 /* This is the maximum size of a single O_DIRECT request, based on the
00338  * kmalloc limit.  We need to fit all of the brw_page structs, each one
00339  * representing PAGE_SIZE worth of user data, into a single buffer, and
00340  * then truncate this to be a full-sized RPC.  For 4kB PAGE_SIZE this is
00341  * up to 22MB for 128kB kmalloc and up to 682MB for 4MB kmalloc. */
00342 #define MAX_DIO_SIZE ((MAX_MALLOC / sizeof(struct brw_page) * PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) & \
00343                       ~(DT_MAX_BRW_SIZE - 1))
00344 
00345 #ifndef HAVE_IOV_ITER_RW
00346 # define iov_iter_rw(iter)      rw
00347 #endif
00348 
00349 #if defined(HAVE_DIRECTIO_ITER) || defined(HAVE_IOV_ITER_RW)
00350 static ssize_t
00351 ll_direct_IO(
00352 # ifndef HAVE_IOV_ITER_RW
00353              int rw,
00354 # endif
00355              struct kiocb *iocb, struct iov_iter *iter,
00356              loff_t file_offset)
00357 {
00358         struct lu_env *env;
00359         struct cl_io *io;
00360         struct file *file = iocb->ki_filp;
00361         struct inode *inode = file->f_mapping->host;
00362         ssize_t count = iov_iter_count(iter);
00363         ssize_t tot_bytes = 0, result = 0;
00364         size_t size = MAX_DIO_SIZE;
00365         __u16 refcheck;
00366 
00367         /* FIXME: io smaller than PAGE_SIZE is broken on ia64 ??? */
00368         if ((file_offset & ~PAGE_MASK) || (count & ~PAGE_MASK))
00369                 return -EINVAL;
00370 
00371         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p), size=%zd (max %lu), "
00372                "offset=%lld=%llx, pages %zd (max %lu)\n",
00373                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode, count, MAX_DIO_SIZE,
00374                file_offset, file_offset, count >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT,
00375                MAX_DIO_SIZE >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00376 
00377         /* Check that all user buffers are aligned as well */
00378         if (iov_iter_alignment(iter) & ~PAGE_MASK)
00379                 return -EINVAL;
00380 
00381         env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
00382         LASSERT(!IS_ERR(env));
00383         io = vvp_env_io(env)->vui_cl.cis_io;
00384         LASSERT(io != NULL);
00385 
00386         /* 0. Need locking between buffered and direct access. and race with
00387          *    size changing by concurrent truncates and writes.
00388          * 1. Need inode mutex to operate transient pages.
00389          */
00390         if (iov_iter_rw(iter) == READ)
00391                 mutex_lock(&inode->i_mutex);
00392 
00393         while (iov_iter_count(iter)) {
00394                 struct page **pages;
00395                 size_t offs;
00396 
00397                 count = min_t(size_t, iov_iter_count(iter), size);
00398                 if (iov_iter_rw(iter) == READ) {
00399                         if (file_offset >= i_size_read(inode))
00400                                 break;
00401 
00402                         if (file_offset + count > i_size_read(inode))
00403                                 count = i_size_read(inode) - file_offset;
00404                 }
00405 
00406                 result = iov_iter_get_pages_alloc(iter, &pages, count, &offs);
00407                 if (likely(result > 0)) {
00408                         int n = DIV_ROUND_UP(result + offs, PAGE_SIZE);
00409 
00410                         result = ll_direct_IO_seg(env, io, iov_iter_rw(iter),
00411                                                   inode, result, file_offset,
00412                                                   pages, n);
00413                         ll_free_user_pages(pages, n,
00414                                            iov_iter_rw(iter) == READ);
00415 
00416                 }
00417                 if (unlikely(result <= 0)) {
00418                         /* If we can't allocate a large enough buffer
00419                          * for the request, shrink it to a smaller
00420                          * PAGE_SIZE multiple and try again.
00421                          * We should always be able to kmalloc for a
00422                          * page worth of page pointers = 4MB on i386. */
00423                         if (result == -ENOMEM &&
00424                             size > (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE / sizeof(*pages)) *
00425                                     PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00426                                 size = ((((size / 2) - 1) |
00427                                         ~PAGE_MASK) + 1) & PAGE_MASK;
00428                                 CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "DIO size now %zu\n",
00429                                        size);
00430                                 continue;
00431                         }
00432 
00433                         GOTO(out, result);
00434                 }
00435 
00436                 iov_iter_advance(iter, result);
00437                 tot_bytes += result;
00438                 file_offset += result;
00439         }
00440 out:
00441         if (iov_iter_rw(iter) == READ)
00442                 mutex_unlock(&inode->i_mutex);
00443 
00444         if (tot_bytes > 0) {
00445                 struct vvp_io *vio = vvp_env_io(env);
00446 
00447                 /* no commit async for direct IO */
00448                 vio->u.write.vui_written += tot_bytes;
00449         }
00450 
00451         cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00452         return tot_bytes ? : result;
00453 }
00454 #else /* !HAVE_DIRECTIO_ITER && !HAVE_IOV_ITER_RW */
00455 
00456 static inline int ll_get_user_pages(int rw, unsigned long user_addr,
00457                                     size_t size, struct page ***pages,
00458                                     int *max_pages)
00459 {
00460         int result = -ENOMEM;
00461 
00462         /* set an arbitrary limit to prevent arithmetic overflow */
00463         if (size > MAX_DIRECTIO_SIZE) {
00464                 *pages = NULL;
00465                 return -EFBIG;
00466         }
00467 
00468         *max_pages = (user_addr + size + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1) >>
00469                       PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00470         *max_pages -= user_addr >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00471 
00472         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(*pages, *max_pages * sizeof(**pages));
00473         if (*pages) {
00474                 down_read(&current->mm->mmap_sem);
00475                 result = get_user_pages(current, current->mm, user_addr,
00476                                         *max_pages, (rw == READ), 0, *pages,
00477                                         NULL);
00478                 up_read(&current->mm->mmap_sem);
00479                 if (unlikely(result <= 0))
00480                         OBD_FREE_LARGE(*pages, *max_pages * sizeof(**pages));
00481         }
00482 
00483         return result;
00484 }
00485 
00486 static ssize_t
00487 ll_direct_IO(int rw, struct kiocb *iocb, const struct iovec *iov,
00488              loff_t file_offset, unsigned long nr_segs)
00489 {
00490         struct lu_env *env;
00491         struct cl_io *io;
00492         struct file *file = iocb->ki_filp;
00493         struct inode *inode = file->f_mapping->host;
00494         ssize_t count = iov_length(iov, nr_segs);
00495         ssize_t tot_bytes = 0, result = 0;
00496         unsigned long seg = 0;
00497         size_t size = MAX_DIO_SIZE;
00498         __u16 refcheck;
00499         ENTRY;
00500 
00501         /* FIXME: io smaller than PAGE_SIZE is broken on ia64 ??? */
00502         if ((file_offset & ~PAGE_MASK) || (count & ~PAGE_MASK))
00503                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00504 
00505         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p), size=%zd (max %lu), "
00506                "offset=%lld=%llx, pages %zd (max %lu)\n",
00507                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode, count, MAX_DIO_SIZE,
00508                file_offset, file_offset, count >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT,
00509                MAX_DIO_SIZE >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00510 
00511         /* Check that all user buffers are aligned as well */
00512         for (seg = 0; seg < nr_segs; seg++) {
00513                 if (((unsigned long)iov[seg].iov_base & ~PAGE_MASK) ||
00514                     (iov[seg].iov_len & ~PAGE_MASK))
00515                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00516         }
00517 
00518         env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
00519         LASSERT(!IS_ERR(env));
00520         io = vvp_env_io(env)->vui_cl.cis_io;
00521         LASSERT(io != NULL);
00522 
00523         for (seg = 0; seg < nr_segs; seg++) {
00524                 size_t iov_left = iov[seg].iov_len;
00525                 unsigned long user_addr = (unsigned long)iov[seg].iov_base;
00526 
00527                 if (rw == READ) {
00528                         if (file_offset >= i_size_read(inode))
00529                                 break;
00530                         if (file_offset + iov_left > i_size_read(inode))
00531                                 iov_left = i_size_read(inode) - file_offset;
00532                 }
00533 
00534                 while (iov_left > 0) {
00535                         struct page **pages;
00536                         int page_count, max_pages = 0;
00537                         size_t bytes;
00538 
00539                         bytes = min(size, iov_left);
00540                         page_count = ll_get_user_pages(rw, user_addr, bytes,
00541                                                        &pages, &max_pages);
00542                         if (likely(page_count > 0)) {
00543                                 if (unlikely(page_count <  max_pages))
00544                                         bytes = page_count << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00545                                 result = ll_direct_IO_seg(env, io, rw, inode,
00546                                                           bytes, file_offset,
00547                                                           pages, page_count);
00548                                 ll_free_user_pages(pages, max_pages, rw==READ);
00549                         } else if (page_count == 0) {
00550                                 GOTO(out, result = -EFAULT);
00551                         } else {
00552                                 result = page_count;
00553                         }
00554                         if (unlikely(result <= 0)) {
00555                                 /* If we can't allocate a large enough buffer
00556                                  * for the request, shrink it to a smaller
00557                                  * PAGE_SIZE multiple and try again.
00558                                  * We should always be able to kmalloc for a
00559                                  * page worth of page pointers = 4MB on i386. */
00560                                 if (result == -ENOMEM &&
00561                                     size > (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE / sizeof(*pages)) *
00562                                            PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00563                                         size = ((((size / 2) - 1) |
00564                                                  ~PAGE_CACHE_MASK) + 1) &
00565                                                 PAGE_CACHE_MASK;
00566                                         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "DIO size now %zu\n",
00567                                                size);
00568                                         continue;
00569                                 }
00570 
00571                                 GOTO(out, result);
00572                         }
00573 
00574                         tot_bytes += result;
00575                         file_offset += result;
00576                         iov_left -= result;
00577                         user_addr += result;
00578                 }
00579         }
00580 out:
00581         if (tot_bytes > 0) {
00582                 struct vvp_io *vio = vvp_env_io(env);
00583 
00584                 /* no commit async for direct IO */
00585                 vio->u.write.vui_written += tot_bytes;
00586         }
00587 
00588         cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00589         RETURN(tot_bytes ? tot_bytes : result);
00590 }
00591 #endif /* HAVE_DIRECTIO_ITER || HAVE_IOV_ITER_RW */
00592 
00596 static int ll_prepare_partial_page(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
00597                                    struct cl_page *pg)
00598 {
00599         struct cl_attr *attr   = vvp_env_thread_attr(env);
00600         struct cl_object *obj  = io->ci_obj;
00601         struct vvp_page *vpg   = cl_object_page_slice(obj, pg);
00602         loff_t          offset = cl_offset(obj, vvp_index(vpg));
00603         int             result;
00604 
00605         cl_object_attr_lock(obj);
00606         result = cl_object_attr_get(env, obj, attr);
00607         cl_object_attr_unlock(obj);
00608         if (result == 0) {
00609                 /*
00610                  * If are writing to a new page, no need to read old data.
00611                  * The extent locking will have updated the KMS, and for our
00612                  * purposes here we can treat it like i_size.
00613                  */
00614                 if (attr->cat_kms <= offset) {
00615                         char *kaddr = ll_kmap_atomic(vpg->vpg_page, KM_USER0);
00616 
00617                         memset(kaddr, 0, cl_page_size(obj));
00618                         ll_kunmap_atomic(kaddr, KM_USER0);
00619                 } else if (vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate)
00620                         vpg->vpg_ra_used = 1;
00621                 else
00622                         result = ll_page_sync_io(env, io, pg, CRT_READ);
00623         }
00624         return result;
00625 }
00626 
00627 static int ll_write_begin(struct file *file, struct address_space *mapping,
00628                           loff_t pos, unsigned len, unsigned flags,
00629                           struct page **pagep, void **fsdata)
00630 {
00631         struct ll_cl_context *lcc;
00632         const struct lu_env  *env;
00633         struct cl_io   *io;
00634         struct cl_page *page;
00635 
00636         struct cl_object *clob = ll_i2info(mapping->host)->lli_clob;
00637         pgoff_t index = pos >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00638         struct page *vmpage = NULL;
00639         unsigned from = pos & (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1);
00640         unsigned to = from + len;
00641         int result = 0;
00642         ENTRY;
00643 
00644         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "Writing %lu of %d to %d bytes\n", index, from, len);
00645 
00646         lcc = ll_cl_find(file);
00647         if (lcc == NULL) {
00648                 io = NULL;
00649                 GOTO(out, result = -EIO);
00650         }
00651 
00652         env = lcc->lcc_env;
00653         io  = lcc->lcc_io;
00654 
00655         /* To avoid deadlock, try to lock page first. */
00656         vmpage = grab_cache_page_nowait(mapping, index);
00657 
00658         if (unlikely(vmpage == NULL ||
00659                      PageDirty(vmpage) || PageWriteback(vmpage))) {
00660                 struct vvp_io *vio = vvp_env_io(env);
00661                 struct cl_page_list *plist = &vio->u.write.vui_queue;
00662 
00663                 /* if the page is already in dirty cache, we have to commit
00664                  * the pages right now; otherwise, it may cause deadlock
00665                  * because it holds page lock of a dirty page and request for
00666                  * more grants. It's okay for the dirty page to be the first
00667                  * one in commit page list, though. */
00668                 if (vmpage != NULL && plist->pl_nr > 0) {
00669                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00670                         page_cache_release(vmpage);
00671                         vmpage = NULL;
00672                 }
00673 
00674                 /* commit pages and then wait for page lock */
00675                 result = vvp_io_write_commit(env, io);
00676                 if (result < 0)
00677                         GOTO(out, result);
00678 
00679                 if (vmpage == NULL) {
00680                         vmpage = grab_cache_page_write_begin(mapping, index,
00681                                                              flags);
00682                         if (vmpage == NULL)
00683                                 GOTO(out, result = -ENOMEM);
00684                 }
00685         }
00686 
00687         page = cl_page_find(env, clob, vmpage->index, vmpage, CPT_CACHEABLE);
00688         if (IS_ERR(page))
00689                 GOTO(out, result = PTR_ERR(page));
00690 
00691         lcc->lcc_page = page;
00692         lu_ref_add(&page->cp_reference, "cl_io", io);
00693 
00694         cl_page_assume(env, io, page);
00695         if (!PageUptodate(vmpage)) {
00696                 /*
00697                  * We're completely overwriting an existing page,
00698                  * so _don't_ set it up to date until commit_write
00699                  */
00700                 if (from == 0 && to == PAGE_SIZE) {
00701                         CL_PAGE_HEADER(D_PAGE, env, page, "full page write\n");
00702                         POISON_PAGE(vmpage, 0x11);
00703                 } else {
00704                         /* TODO: can be optimized at OSC layer to check if it
00705                          * is a lockless IO. In that case, it's not necessary
00706                          * to read the data. */
00707                         result = ll_prepare_partial_page(env, io, page);
00708                         if (result == 0)
00709                                 SetPageUptodate(vmpage);
00710                 }
00711         }
00712         if (result < 0)
00713                 cl_page_unassume(env, io, page);
00714         EXIT;
00715 out:
00716         if (result < 0) {
00717                 if (vmpage != NULL) {
00718                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00719                         page_cache_release(vmpage);
00720                 }
00721                 if (io)
00722                         io->ci_result = result;
00723         } else {
00724                 *pagep = vmpage;
00725                 *fsdata = lcc;
00726         }
00727         RETURN(result);
00728 }
00729 
00730 static int ll_write_end(struct file *file, struct address_space *mapping,
00731                         loff_t pos, unsigned len, unsigned copied,
00732                         struct page *vmpage, void *fsdata)
00733 {
00734         struct ll_cl_context *lcc = fsdata;
00735         const struct lu_env *env;
00736         struct cl_io *io;
00737         struct vvp_io *vio;
00738         struct cl_page *page;
00739         unsigned from = pos & (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1);
00740         bool unplug = false;
00741         int result = 0;
00742         ENTRY;
00743 
00744         page_cache_release(vmpage);
00745 
00746         LASSERT(lcc != NULL);
00747         env  = lcc->lcc_env;
00748         page = lcc->lcc_page;
00749         io   = lcc->lcc_io;
00750         vio  = vvp_env_io(env);
00751 
00752         LASSERT(cl_page_is_owned(page, io));
00753         if (copied > 0) {
00754                 struct cl_page_list *plist = &vio->u.write.vui_queue;
00755 
00756                 lcc->lcc_page = NULL; /* page will be queued */
00757 
00758                 /* Add it into write queue */
00759                 cl_page_list_add(plist, page);
00760                 if (plist->pl_nr == 1) /* first page */
00761                         vio->u.write.vui_from = from;
00762                 else
00763                         LASSERT(from == 0);
00764                 vio->u.write.vui_to = from + copied;
00765 
00766                 /* To address the deadlock in balance_dirty_pages() where
00767                  * this dirty page may be written back in the same thread. */
00768                 if (PageDirty(vmpage))
00769                         unplug = true;
00770 
00771                 /* We may have one full RPC, commit it soon */
00772                 if (plist->pl_nr >= PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES)
00773                         unplug = true;
00774 
00775                 CL_PAGE_DEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, env, page,
00776                               "queued page: %d.\n", plist->pl_nr);
00777         } else {
00778                 cl_page_disown(env, io, page);
00779 
00780                 lcc->lcc_page = NULL;
00781                 lu_ref_del(&page->cp_reference, "cl_io", io);
00782                 cl_page_put(env, page);
00783 
00784                 /* page list is not contiguous now, commit it now */
00785                 unplug = true;
00786         }
00787         if (unplug ||
00788             file->f_flags & O_SYNC || IS_SYNC(file->f_path.dentry->d_inode))
00789                 result = vvp_io_write_commit(env, io);
00790 
00791         if (result < 0)
00792                 io->ci_result = result;
00793         RETURN(result >= 0 ? copied : result);
00794 }
00795 
00796 #ifdef CONFIG_MIGRATION
00797 static int ll_migratepage(struct address_space *mapping,
00798                           struct page *newpage, struct page *page
00799 #ifdef HAVE_MIGRATEPAGE_4ARGS
00800                           , enum migrate_mode mode
00801 #endif
00802         )
00803 {
00804         /* Always fail page migration until we have a proper implementation */
00805         return -EIO;
00806 }
00807 #endif
00808 
00809 const struct address_space_operations ll_aops = {
00810         .readpage       = ll_readpage,
00811         .direct_IO      = ll_direct_IO,
00812         .writepage      = ll_writepage,
00813         .writepages     = ll_writepages,
00814         .set_page_dirty = __set_page_dirty_nobuffers,
00815         .write_begin    = ll_write_begin,
00816         .write_end      = ll_write_end,
00817         .invalidatepage = ll_invalidatepage,
00818         .releasepage    = (void *)ll_releasepage,
00819 #ifdef CONFIG_MIGRATION
00820         .migratepage    = ll_migratepage,
00821 #endif
00822 };
